description.narrative: Sustainable and climate resilient livelihoods defined and local climate change adaptation capacities enhanced among women’s groups.

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: OUTCOME level (Outcome 1): 1.1. level of awareness on environment protection and climate change in pilot districts as a result of project interventions 1.2. no. of LPAs from the pilot districts which apply Strategic Environmental Assessment Law with integrated gender aspects 1.3. extent to which the capacity development programme of the project for women/women entrepreneurs implemented Output level (under Outcome 1): Output 1.1. 1.1.1. Number of local development plans that ensures women's equal access to resources for sustainable food production Output 1.2. 1.2.1. Number of guides elaborated, presented and disseminated Output 1.3. 1.3.1. Number of LPA and civil society representative participating in the projects workshops; reports on the collected feedback 1.3.2. Number of women and women's groups engaged in debates on environmental impacts Output 1.4. 1.4.1. Number of inquiries/ no. of documents developed with project support Output 1.5 1.5.1. Number of women headed households participating in the workshops Output 1.6. 1.6.1. Number of women entrepreneurs participating in the workshop Output 1.7. 1.7.1. Number of developed knowledge products by the project OUTCOME level (Outcome 2): 2.1. % increase in the number of NGOs engaging in the environment, climate change and gender initiatives as a result of project interventions 2.2. Number of NGOs which apply improved internal policies as a result of project interventions Output level (under Outcome 2): Output 2.1. 2.1.1. Extent to which the identified assurance plans are implemented Output 2.2. 2.2.1 Number of NGOs trained on climate change, environment and gender Output 2.3. 2.3.1. Number of trainings delivered by NGOs on climate change and environment-related topics s to LPA and women (households and businesses) Output 2.4. 2.4.1. Extent to which NGOs provide inputs to the knowledge products developed by the project OUTCOME level (Outcome 3): 3.1. Extent to which the project's grant programme is implemente

comment.narrative: OUTCOME level: Outcome 1 "Sustainable, climate resilient and environmentally sound livelihoods defined and local capacities&knowledge on environment, climate change and gender enhanced and implemented successfully"): 1.1. Data not available (a survey will be carried out at the initiation to determine the baseline) 1.2. Data not available (a survey will be carried out at the initiation to determine the baseline) 1.3. The capacity development programme of the project not available Output level, (under Outcome 1): Output 1.1 "Gender, environment protection and climate change adaptation solutions mainstreamed into local development plans": 1.1.1 - There are 4 local development plans with only climate change mainstreamed (from NAP project) Output 1.2. "Guides for LPAs on application of environment- and climate-related legal and regulatory framework developed and disseminated ": 1.2.1. No guides on environment and climate change related legislation applicable to LPAs are available Output 1.3. " Workshops on particular environmental legislative acts conducted (ex. SEA, EIA) " 1.3.1. Data not available on the number of workshops organized by the project for LPAs and CSOs 1.3.2. Data not available on number of women and women's groups engaged in debates on environmental impacts Output 1.4. "Mentoring for application of legislations related to climate and environment provided at request as well as support in integrating gender aspects into local planning documents" 1.4.1. Data not available on the no. of inquiries/ no. of documents developed with project support Output 1.5. "Workshops for women-headed households on environment protection, climate change and related income generation potential organized": 1.5.1. Workshops organized by the project for women-headed households not available Output 1.6. "Workshops for women entrepreneurs on environment protection, climate change and related income generation potential organized": 1.6.1. Workshops organized by the project

OUTCOME 1 Target 1.1. A baseline study conducted to establish the initial level of awareness of on environment protection and climate change in pilot districts as a result of project interventions Target 1.2. None this year Target 1.3.The capacity development programme for women/men entrepreneurs is implemented at the level of 20% Output 1.1. Target 1.1.1. Six (6) Local Development Plans mainstreamed with Environment, Climate Change and Gender Output 1.2. Target 1.2.1 At least two (2) Guides on environment and climate change related legislation applicable to LPAs are available Output 1.3. Target 1.3.1 One (1) National level workshop for LPAs and CSOs on environmental, climate and gender topics organised Target 1.3.2 Sixty (60) women engaged in debates on environmental topics Output 1.4. Target 1.4.1 None this year Output 1.5. Target 1.5.1 At least 300 women headed households participate in the workshops organised by the project Output 1.6. Target 1.6.1. At least 60 women entrepreneurs participate in the workshops organised by the project Output 1.7. Target 1.7.1. At least two (2) knowledge products on environment-friendly and climate resilient practices and income generating activities developed based on specific needs of communities and women/men entrepreneurs
OUTCOME 2 Target 2.1. A 5% increase in the number of NGOs engaged in the environment, climate change and gender initiatives as a result of project intervention Target 2.2. Six (6) NGOs apply improved internal policies as a result of project interventions Output 2.1. Target 2.1.1.Sixty percent (60%) of the assurance plans identified by the project implemented by NGOs Output 2.2. Target 2.2.1. A total of 30 NGOs trained on climate change, environment and gender Output 2.3. Target 2.3.1. Seven (7) training events on climate change and environment-related thematic workshops delivered by NGOs to to LPA and women (households and businesses) Output 2.4. Target 2.4.1. NGOs contribute with 10% to the content of the knowledge products developed by the project
OUTCOME 3: to be implemented starting 2021, i.e. no outcome or output level targets in 2020
OUTCOME 4: 4.1. No outcome level target for 2020 Output 4.1. Target 4.1.1. Forty per cent (40%) of the Projects Communication, Outreach and Replication strategy implemented Output 4.2. Target 4.2.1. At least 3 NGOs networks/platforms used to disseminate projects results, good practices and knowledge products Output 4.3. Target 4.3.1. Twenty percent (20%) of projects knowledge products available on online platforms

2020 Results against Outcome and Output level targets set above (same numbering): Result 1.1. Fully achieved: Baseline study commissioned in 2020 to establish the initial level of awareness on environment protection and climate change in pilot districts and data collection completed Result 1.3. Fully achieved: Up to 20% of the Capacity Development Programme for women/men entrepreneurs implemented in 2020 (2 out of 12 training courses planned till 2021 delivered in 2020) Result 1.1.1. Partially achieved: Four (4) Gender Mainstreamed Climate Change and Environmental Protection Action Plans to be integrated in the Local Development Plans of Basarabeasca, Nisporeni, Calarasi and Leova districts for the period 2021-2025 developed. Target to be fully achieved in 2021 Result 1.2.1. Exceeded: Four (4) Guides on environmental and climate change related legislation applicable to LPAs as well as gender equality aspects developed Result 1.3.1. Exceeded: Three regional workshops conducted instead of 1 National workshop for LPAs and CSO on environmental, climate and gender topics Result 1.3.2. Exceeded: 70 women engaged in debates and technical working groups on environmental and climate change issues at regional level Result 1.4.1. N/A Result 1.5.1. Partially achieved: 29 women headed households trained on setting up small-scale climate resilient operations with income generating potential. Target to be fully achieved in 2021 Result 1.6.1. Partially achieved: 34 women entrepreneurs participated in workshops organised by the project on setting up/expanding climate resilient and environmentally friendly operations. Target to be fully achieved in 2021 Result 1.7.1. Exceeded: 6 knowledge products on environment-friendly and climate resilient practices and income generating activities developed based on specific needs of communities and women/men entrepreneurs Result 2.1. Exceeded: at least 10% new NGOs (against the list of 67 from the last Environmental NGO Forum) identified by the Project whose potential to engage in environment, climate change and gender initiatives has increased - as result of the Thematic Capacity Building Programme implemented by the Project which covered a total 40 NGOs in 2020, and the Institutional Capacity Development Programme benefiting 6 environmental NGOs (primarily local level, including from Transnistria region and Gagauzia) Result 2.2. Fully achieved: Six (6) environmental NGOs from both banks of Nistru river selected, trained and mentored to improve their internal policies and capacities on Project Management, Procurement, Financial Management, and Human Resources Management as result of project’s interventions Result 2.1.1. Fully achieved: Up to 70% of the assurance plans produced for the 6 NGOs as result of an-depth System-Based Audit implemented Result 2.2.1. Exceeded: 40 Environmental NGOs trained on Climate Change, Environment and Gender Result 2.3.1. Fully achieved: 3 workshops on climate and environmental legislation and gender delivered to LPAs in target districts and 4 trainings events on climate resilient business development delivered to women-headed households and women and men entrepreneurs in 2 target districts Result 2.4.1. Exceeded: 100% of the knowledge products developed by the Project (i.e. 6 knowledge products for women households and women/men entrepreneurs and 4 Guides for LPAs on climate legislation and gender) were developed by NGOs Result 4.1. N/A Result 4.1.1. Fully achieved: An estimated 40 % of the Project’s Communication, Outreach and Replication Strategy implemented in 2020 through (a) the development of Project’s Visual Identity, (b) complete set of visibility materials for the entire project duration produced; (c) dissemination of project’s results and key activities via press releases to national media, social media, and specialized 5 on-line communities/platforms on environmental/climate change topics Result 4.2.1.Exceeded: Project’s results disseminated on 5 specialized on-line platforms consisting of specialized environmental NGOs and journalists Result 4.3.1. Not achieved: Knowledge products to be finalized and placed in the public domain starting 2021

2021 Results against Outcome and Output level targets set above (same numbering): OUTCOME 1 Outcome 1 level targets: Target 1.1. N/A Result 1.1 N/a
Target 1.2. The LPAs from the pilot districts apply Strategic Environmental Assessment Law with integrated gender aspects - at least 3/ 40 % of acts elaborated by LPA where SEA has been applied Result 1.2. Exceeded: 6 LPAs from the pilot districts guided to apply Strategic Environmental Assessment Law with integrated gender aspects Target 1.3. The capacity development Programme for women/men entrepreneurs is implemented at the level of 40% Result 1.3 Exceeded: Over 80 % of the Capacity Development Programme for women/men entrepreneurs implemented in 2021 (10 out of 12 training courses carried out for women/men entrepreneurs in 2021)
Output level targets, under Outcome 1: Output 1.1. Target 1.1.1.– N/A Result 1.1.1
Output 1.2 Target 1.2.1 At least 1 (one) Guides on environment and climate change related legislation applicable to LPAs are available Result 1.2.1. Fully achieved: The Guide on environmental was supplemented with good practices collected at local level in main environmental area
Output 1.3. Target 1.3.1 At least 9 regional (at the raion level) workshops for LPAs and CSOs on environmental, climate and gender topics organised Result 1.3.1. Fully achieved: 9 offline regional workshops on how to apply environment and climate related legislation at local level, SEA and EIA tools as well as a gender equality perspective to shape and execute climate change adaptation solutions locally, carried out for a total of 223 local government officials (incl. 122 women) from 6 districts (Calarași, Leova, Dubasari, Basarabeasca, UTAG and Nisporeni). Target 1.3.2 120 (one hundred and twenty) women engaged in debates on environmental topics Result 1.3.2. Exceeded: 62 women, representing 6 localities from target area actively engaged in gender, environment and CC mainstreaming in the local documents and 122 women from 6 districts (Calarași, Leova, Dubasari, Basarabeasca, UTAG and Nisporeni) have developed skills to apply environment and climate related legislation at local level
Output 1.4. Target 1.4.1 At least 6 inquiries/ documents developed for application of legislations related to climate and environment provided at request as well as support in integrating gender aspects into local planning documents Result 1.4.1 Six (6) LPAs (Filipeni, Niscani, Tuzara, Borogani, Tigheci, Dezghingea) were assisted on gender, environment and CC mainstreaming and Six (6) local documents developed with project support Output 1.5. Target 1.5.1 At least 300 women headed households participate in the workshops organised by the project Result 1.5.1 Exceeded: 636 women headed households trained on setting up small-scale climate resilient operations with income generating potential. Output 1.6. Target 1.6.1. At least 60 women entrepreneurs participate in the workshops organised by the project Result 1.6.1 Exceeded: 112 women entrepreneurs participated in workshops organised by the project on setting up/expanding climate resilient and environmentally friend
Output 1.7. Target 1.7.1. At least four (4) knowledge products on environment-friendly and climate resilient practices and income generating activities developed based on specific needs of communities and women/men entrepreneurs Result 1.7.1 Exceeded: 6 knowledge products on environment-friendly and climate resilient practices and income generating activities developed based on specific needs of communities and women/men entrepreneurs
OUTCOME 2 Outcome 2 level targets: Target 2.1. A 20% increase in the number of NGOs engaged in the environment, climate change and gender initiatives as a result of project intervention Result 2.2 Exceeded: At least 20% NGOs (additional 31 NGOs) engaged in Training Modules covering the environment, climate change and gender topics, carried out in 2021 Target 2.2.– N/A
Output level targets, under Outcome 2: Output 2.1. Target 2.1.1. Twenty percent (20%) of the assurance plans identified by the project implemented by NGOs Result 2.1.1 Exceeded Eighty percent (80 %) of the assurance plans identified by the project implemented by NGOs
Output 2.2. Target 2.2.1. A total of 37 NGOs trained on climate change, environment and gender Result 2.2.1 Fully achieved: Capacity Building Program for NGOs on Environment, Climate Change and Gender conducted in 2021 for additional 37 environmental NGOS
Output 2.3. Target 2.3.1. Seven (7) training events on climate change and environment-related thematic workshops delivered by NGOs to LPA and women (households and businesses) Result 2.3.1 Exceeded: 9 additional climate change and environment-related thematic informative sessions delivered by the NGOs selected to provide coaching and mentoring to women-headed households and women and men entrepreneurs in 7 target regions Output 2.4. Target 2.4.1. NGOs contribute with 10% to the content of the knowledge products developed by the project Result 2.4.1 Fully achieved: Valuable input estimated at min. 10% provided by the 5 NGOs beneficiaries of Institutional Development program to the 6 knowledge products.
OUTCOME 3: Outcome 3 level targets: Target 3.1. Sixty percent (60 %) of the projects grant programme is implemented by women, women entrepreneurs and LPAs Result 3.1 Partially achieved: All three (3) grants programmes successful launched and a total of 339 applications received. Target 3. 2. Six (6) climate resilient and/or environment-friendly practices put in place by the project Result 3.2 Partially achieved: Eleven (11) grants awarded to women entrepreneurs and 30 grants awarded to communities to implement climate resilient and environment friendly practices. The all 43 projects are due to start early 2022. Target 3.3. None this year Result 3.3 N/A
Output level targets, under Outcome 3: Output 3.1. Target 3.1.1. Forty (40) women-headed households increased their income due to climate change adaptation/mitigation activities Result 3.1.1. Partially achieved: 60 household women pre-selected for financial support for developing environment-friendly income generating activities within households Target 3.1.2. Sixty percent (60%) of business plans are implemented successfully and the expected revenue achieved Result 3.1.2 Partially achieved: Eleven (11) business plans are approved and are at the implementation stage.
Output 3.2. Target 3.2.1. Six (6) women entrepreneurs increased their income due to climate change adaptation/mitigation activities Result 3.1.2 Partially achieved: Eleven (11) women led-enterprises supported to implement Climate resilient and environmentally- sustainable practices.
Target 3.2.2. Sixty percent (60%) of business plan implemented successfully and the expected revenue achieved Result 3.1.2 Partially achieved: Eleven (11) grants agreement signed with women entrepreneurs and works are in progress. Output 3.3. Target 3.3.1. Twenty (20) community grants implemented with project financing Result 3.1.2 Partially achieved: Thirty (30) grants agreement signed with LPAs and works are in progress
Output 3.4. Target 3.4.1. Ten percent (10%) of the NGOs capacitated by the project are involved in the mentoring and coaching to support the LPAs, businesses and households Result 3.1.2 Exceeded: Two (2) NGOs (out of nine selected) beneficiaries of the Institutional Development Program, representing 20 %, involved in the mentoring and coaching to support the LPAs, women-led businesses and women-led households
OUTCOME 4: Outcome 4 level targets: 4.1. Fifty percent (50%) of the projects results, good practices and products are codified Result 3.1.2 Partially achieved: About ten percent (10%) of the projects results, good practices and products were promoted since the implementation of the selected projects started only at the end of the 2021 Output level targets, under Outcome 4: Output 4.1. Target 4.1.1. Thirty per cent (30%) of the Projects Communication, Outreach and Replication strategy implemented Result 3.1.2 Fully achieved: An estimated 30 % of the Project’s Communication, Outreach and Replication Strategy implemented in 2021
Output 4.2. Target 4.2.1. At least one (1) NGO network/platform used to disseminate projects results, good practices and knowledge products Result 3.1.2 Exceeded: Project’s results disseminated on more than 5 specialized on-line platforms consisting of specialized environmental NGOs and journalists Output 4.3. Target 4.3.1. Forty percent (40%) of projects knowledge products available on online platforms Result 3.1.2 Fully achieved: Knowledge products finalized in 2021 placed in the public domain
